WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name W.S. Battey.......................
Address...Glenora, B.C..............
Birthplace...Pipkin City, Ill., U.S.A. in 1875, July.

1. HOUSEHOLD HISTORY

What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1897. With my parents. I was 12 years of age then.
Where did you see us housekeeping? Saltcoats, Ayrshire.
Where had you been living before that? Glenrock, near the Clyde, Scotland.
For how many people did you prepare meals? There were two in our family.
Father & Mother took care of us.
How far was it to your nearest store? There was no store. Dinner then Langleyburg until Saltcoats was established 1888.
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a week.
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, tea, beans, sugar, and tobacco. Dad could not buy a plug of tobacco at one time, and it cost only 25¢.
We lived on short rations part of one Winter, 1888. Had a cow, made our own butter, had our own milk.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Ogilvie's Strong Bakers at $1.50 per 36 lbs.
In what quantities did you buy it? One bag at a time.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.25 - $1.50.
How much did you use prairie flour? As much as we could get, but was in short supply.
Whole wheat flour? Don't remember.
Was flour milled locally? No. How far away? 30 miles. What year? 1887.
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? Can't remember.
What other grain products did you use? A little rice at times.
Cornmeal? A little. Whole wheat? No. Farina? Some.
Other? Later, we went to the flour mill at Milverton and bought back flour and farina, took us a week in Nov. to make the trip.
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Sometimes. How many times? Many times, and it was good.
How did you grind it? Flour. I have 20¢ of my original 5¢.

Which proves we are being de-natured food today.
Store food. Store well, both go together.
Rattray, W.S.
Osoyoos, B.C., 1887 (with parents)

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Oat meal, not rolled. Bread and butter and milk.
tea for the elders, very little coffee.

I left home while many of the younger grew up,
but our main dish was oatmeal and I today never start breakfast unless I have oats. This boxed puffed, rolled,
peanut butter, and all this other monstrosity so called
food is represented in the children today. Nine of our
10 children are still alive. One Sister was killed in a runaway
accident, and there is over 170 direct descendents in Canada
I get a pension, and that is what I have to show for 64 Years of
work. I do NOT drink liquor, but am classed as too big hearted
and my education stopped at age of 12 Years, but I am still
a going concern.

31. Rattray, Wellwood Scott
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

I will give you my reactions to this question. There is no animal on Earth today that knows less about feeding than man.

The so-called food is a lie; most of it, we are too busy making money to worry about food, but this joining up of the young men who sell the tales, wait and see. No teeth, poor vision, bottle babies drowning by the hundreds. Canada's liquor bill for 1949, and it is away above these figures now. For the Prov. of B.C. alone $57,000,000, liquor profits increased in 1950 one and half million dollars. The U.S.A. spend $2 billion, 800 million in one year, you can't expect to raise a healthy nation with figures for so value in return except wrecked homes, cars, people, suicides mental cases etc., and cigarettes were unknown when I was a boy, today the U.S.A. takes 1 billion, 800 million dollars in this racket, and what are the Churches doing about it, or anyone else for that matter.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

I never relied on purchased processed food, there is no money in pure food. Pure food is a lie. Half the people are dying from putrid meat. Cancer was unknown years ago. We have cancer, now the racket is asking for funds to start a heart fund. If people would take some exercise instead of riding, we would grow, we don't grow now, we evolve, in other words we are what we eat, believe it or not, mentally or physically. Young women telling mature mothers over the air how to raise their kids, give them the bottle so I may have time to go to the numerous shows, and nite life, while the baby sitters give liquor to the baby, oh yes, we are progressing.

Listen to the radio, read the pulp that is allowed to be sold murder, crime, etc., the children love this stuff. Crowds will block the entrances to shows, prize fights etc., pay $20.00 to see two men literally try to kill each other, they expect that. Thrills is what they pay for and they want it. Same with sex, where are the morals of our mothers gone, how can we blame the delinquency among the young, it is NOT the children's fault, it is the fault of our teaching, or not teaching. We will learn when it's too late.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].

We, or rather some of my younger sisters walked to school 3 miles after bringing in the cows, that was their job. What is our universities turning out, you have it in the latest scandal where the TOP boys sold out their team (basket ball) and don't think it ends there, as long as we have the type of Govts. we have today, it will get worse. No, give me the old days when one could go away from home for a month and we never had a key to our house, try it today. You may not agree with me, but I have 76 Years of experience in the best Country in the World, I have lived it, I was never in a debt court in my life, and I have done some big building, running into the hundred thousands, I owe nothing to any, and hope I never will, but it is getting harder with only one of on pension. Wife and I will be, if we live till 26th Nov. 50 Years together. Hollywood I say is a STATE of mind, not a place, are our Govts. blind to what is going on, or do they care. A baseball player in U.S.A. gets $100,000 for a season of ball, can we win wars under such confusion, what is wrong, it is not that we cannot produce, it is the middle men who keep from the market the goods, like the potato deal in U.S. last Year. Paid $1.25 per bush. and sold them to Italy at 1 cent a hundred lbs. and destroyed the rest, which might have been given to some of the starving millions throughout the World, but bombs may be better, we WILL see, and soon.

I hope I have not bored you with this story.

W.S. Ratray.

I have always relied on purchased processed food, there is no money in pure food. Pure food is a lie. Half the people are dying from putrid meat. Cancer was unknown years ago. We have cancer, now the racket is raising funds to start a heart fund. If people would take some exercise instead of riding, we would grow, we don't grow now, we evolve, in other words we are what we eat, believe it or not, mentally or physically. Young women telling mature mothers over the air how to raise their kids. Give them the bottle so I may have time to go to the numerous shows, and night life, while the baby sitters give liquor to the baby, oh yes, we are progressing.

Listen to the radio, read the pulp that is allowed to be sold murder, crime, etc., the children love this stuff. Crowds will block the entrances to shows, prize fights etc., pay $20,000 to see two men literally try to kill each other, they expect that. Thrills is what they pay for and they want it. Same with sex, where are the morals of our mothers gone, how can we blame the delinquency among the young, it is NOT the children's fault, it is the fault of our teaching, or not teaching. We will learn what's too late.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page if more space is needed).

We, or rather some of my younger sisters walked to school 3 miles after bringing in the cows, that was their job. What is our universities turning out, you have it in the latest scandal where the KP boys sold out their team (basket ball) and don't think it ends there, as long as we have the type of boys we have today, it will get worse. No, give me the old days when one could go away from home for a month and we never had a key to our house, try it today. You may not agree with me, but I have 76 years of experience in the best Country in the World, I have lived it, I was never in a debt court in my life, and I have done some big building, running into the hundreds thousands, I owe nothing to any, and hope I never will, but it is getting harder with only one of on pension. Wife and I will be, if we live till 26th Nov. 50 Years together. Hollywood I say is a STATE of mind, not a place, are our Govt. blind to what is going on, or do they care. A baseball player in U.S.A. gets $100,000 for a season of ball, can we win were under such confusion, what is wrong, it is not that we cannot produce, it is the middle men who keep from the market the goods, like the potato deal in U.S. last year paid $1.25 per bush, and sold them to Italy at 1 cent a hundred lbs. and destroyed the rest, which might have been given to some of the starving millions throughout the world, but bombs may be better, we WILL see, and soon.

I hope I have not bored you with this story.

W.J. Rattey.

MONKEY BUSINESS.

In eighteen hundred fifty nine a man named Darwin said
We descended from the monkey, the people shook their head,
But from the news we get today we better off might be
If monkeys were our ancestors, we each would own a tree.

They do not hire, rent or build, nor plow or reap or till,
And as for lawyers, they have none, so monkeys make no will,
They have no constitution, no dictatorship or king,
A lesson we might learn from them, as they have everything.

They don't appoint some monkeys to manage their affairs,
They don't maintain an army to shoot you unawares,
They eat their fill and spend their time amid the flowers and trees,
Their jungle roads and streets are free, they don't pay any fees.

They have no sickness or complaints, no cancer or T.B.,
They do not walk with crutches nor wear glasses such as we,
And as for failure of the heart, just watch them in the zoo
We never had an athlete out-strip what they can do.

They never had a trust company, a bank, or even cash,
They never had a master, nor slave to any lash,
Their monkey customs are obeyed by everyone alike,
And topping all their actions, they never had a strike.

They have no radio or press, they do not advertise,
Their minds are not confused stall with soap, or soup or lies,
For their existence, like our own, depends on Nature's will,
They live their life as monkeys till they journey o'er the hill.

Now if you're satisfied with what our system has in store,
Just hang around and listen and you may get the score,
According to what I opine, and here the matter ends,
We're heading for the jungle, and may meet our little friends.

S. Rettrey
Oscycoos, B.C. Feb. 22nd/51.
